paragraph1.content: Augmented Reality is a revolutionary tool in the construction field, enabling engineers and developers to display 3D engineering models directly over real-world terrain, giving work teams and clients a clearer and more accurate view before actual implementation.

paragraph2.content: Through this technology, projects and designs can be simulated within a real environment, errors can be detected early, and waste in time and costs can be reduced. It also contributes to facilitating communication between design, implementation, and client teams, and enhances the speed of decision-making and the quality of final results.

paragraph3.title: Artificial Intelligence and Internet of Things Services
paragraph3.subtitle: Cement Compressive Strength Prediction Service for 28 Days
paragraph3.challengeContent: In the cement and building materials industry, 28-day compressive strength tests are the fundamental standard for determining cement quality and usability. However, these traditional tests take a long time of up to four weeks, leading to delays in production and quality control decisions, negatively affecting project implementation speed and operational efficiency.
paragraph3.solutionContent: By leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, an advanced model is developed capable of instant prediction of expected compressive strength after 28 days. This model relies on analyzing chemical data of cement components immediately after leaving production lines. Instead of waiting for weeks, results can be obtained in just a few minutes.
impactPoints: Accelerating Production Decisions: Thanks to instant prediction, cement factories can make necessary adjustments in a timely manner.
Improving Quality Control: Precise monitoring of final product quality from the early stages of production.
Reducing Waste and Costs: Early detection of any defects or weaknesses in the mix contributes to reducing losses.
Enhancing Operational Efficiency: Accelerating production cycles and achieving greater stability in performance.
paragraph3.valueAddedContent: This service represents a qualitative leap in the cement industry, as it is not limited to saving time and costs only, but also enhances companies' competitiveness by improving their product quality and ensuring rapid response to market requirements and major construction projects.

whyUs.title: Fuel Automation

paragraph1.content: Smart solutions for managing fuel for all your vehicles

paragraph2.content: GasTech's automation system provides concrete and contracting companies with an integrated solution for efficient and transparent fuel management, where vehicles are automatically identified when refueling and consumption is recorded directly within the system and controlled from central management, ensuring prevention of waste and manipulation, and providing accurate reports that help reduce costs and improve operational efficiency.

whyUs.paragraph3: The service is an automatic RFID system installed in company vehicles and connected to fuel pumps and tanks at fuel stations. Each vehicle has an RFID card or device that automatically identifies it when refueling, thus:
features: Records every refueling operation (fuel quantity, refueling time, vehicle number).
Provides company management with accurate reports on fuel consumption for each project or vehicle.
Reduces waste and prevents fuel manipulation.
whyUs.paragraph4: The service is an integrated automated system that monitors and controls fuel supply to company vehicles through an RFID card/device for each vehicle, with a technical platform for operations management and continuous technical support.

ministryStandards.title: Ministry of Energy Standards and Requirements
ministryStandards.subtitle: For qualifying fuel stations and ensuring quality and operational efficiency

description.prefix: The GasTech system is distinguished by its compliance with the following standards, which the Ministry of Energy requires to be available for the facility to be qualified to manage fuel stations:
description.content: system is distinguished by its compliance with the following standards, which the Ministry of Energy requires to be available for the facility to be qualified to manage fuel stations:

standards.electronicIntegration: Establishing a central electronic integration system responsible for taking pump readings, knowing the quantities of fuel sold from each pump, and controlling the instant and remote change of energy product prices in pumps and external screens for displaying energy product prices in fuel stations affiliated with the facility (Forecourt Controller).
standards.centralLinking: Commitment to the unified central linking of all systems that require linking by the concerned authorities, such as modifying prices on pumps and price screens instantly remotely, and other systems.
standards.fuelMonitoring: Establishing an automated system for monitoring fuel in tanks through the use of an automatic tank gauge (ATG) that allows real-time remote inventory monitoring.
standards.transportManagement: Establishing a transport management system (System Management Transportation) that manages fuel requests from the time of request to unloading the product in station tanks.
standards.erpSystem: Providing an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system for human resources and retail sales, automatically covering all systems including fuel and non-fuel operations in general, linking point-of-sale systems, various payment systems, cash, electronic payment system, pumps, automated tank reading system, and others.
standards.cloudBased: All communications between automation systems, software, and other devices should be cloud-based.
standards.mobileApps: Mobile applications (Apple and Android) including information about the facility such as products offered, prices, station locations, working hours, offers, and customer complaints.
